intro: Lepidaria tetrantha, commonly known as the four-stamen grass, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Poaceae. It is characterized by its slender, grass-like appearance with narrow, linear leaves and small, clustered inflorescences. The plant produces tiny, spikelet-based flowers that are typically wind-pollinated. Lepidaria tetrantha is native to tropical and subtropical regions, often found in moist, well-drained soils. Its botanical features make it a common species in grassland and wetland ecosystems.
